intro: Tecoma ipe f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, glabrous bark and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping. Its rapid growth and ability to attract pollinators make it both ecologically and aesthetically valuable.
